meanings.sent1: In the feudality of the past, lords owned land and peasants worked for them.
meanings.sent2: Feudality was a social structure where loyalty to a lord was crucial.
meanings.sent3: The feudality of knights and castles seems like a game of make-believe.
meanings.sent4: The concept of feudality can be seen as a chessboard where each piece has a role to play.
meanings.sent5: The feudality of the Middle Ages was like a puzzle with many interconnected pieces.

meanings.definition: The state or quality of being feudal
meanings.sent1: The feudality of the kingdom was evident in the strict hierarchy.
meanings.sent2: Feudality brought about a sense of duty and obligation among vassals.
meanings.sent3: The feudality of the land felt like a never-ending story of obligations.
meanings.sent4: The feudality of the society resembled a web of interconnected relationships.
meanings.sent5: The feudality of the system was like a tapestry woven with threads of loyalty and service.
